GameData.LocalizedText:
Seydlitz
Seydlitz, you are a legendary figure who never sank in the Battle of Jutland. Unyielding to crown your reputation, achievements to honor your glory, you are the most sharp blade of the Iron Blood, with the determination to cut off all enemies. Let's move forward, the eternal ship of friendship! You will never stop at Scapa Flow! The sparkling sea under the sunset is the reflection of your glorious achievements.
Salute! Your orders, Commandant!
The best of Seydlitz's army will help her defeat opponent after opponent.
Either way, Seydlitz is a headache to deal with. Her army has a strong offense when it's in good condition and a good defense when it's not. Moreover, Seydlitz's army can retreat to its own city at any time, which greatly improves her army's fighting ability. The [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great Generals and [ICON_GreatAdmiral] Great Admirals are very important to Seydlitz, as they not only give Seydlitz's armies extra [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and [ICON_Movement] Movement, but they also help Seydlitz have the world's first Corps and Fleets, Army and Armadas. All of this gives Seydlitz's armies the power to bring death to their arrogant enemies.
The battlecruiser Seydlitz was a battlecruiser of the Imperial German Navy begun construction in 1911, with no equivalent. The ship in the Mauch class battlecruiser (big cruiser) based on the improved design, in order to improve the seaworthiness of the performance, increase the bow dry side; strengthen the hull strength, in the armor and watertight protection on the big improvement, the side of the waterline defense armor thickness is close to the tonnage of the battleships of the same size, the development of the German battlecruiser with the status of the beginning and the end. The ship was named after Baron Friedrich Wilhelm von Seydlitz, a Prussian general in the 18th century.
Seydlitz participated in many large fleet operations during World War I, including the Battle of Dogger Sandbank and the Battle of Jutland Sea. This ship suffered serious damage in both battles.
In the Battle of Dogger Shoal, a 13.5-inch shell from the British battleship cruiser Lion hit the aft turret of Seydlitz, almost causing an explosion in the ammunition depot. Based on the lessons learned from this operation, the German Navy has improved the protective measures for ammunition storage rooms and ammunition transport channels to prevent damage to the turret and its ammunition transport channels, which could cause the fire to spread to the ammunition depot and endanger the safety of the entire ship.
In the Battle of Jutland, in the early stages of the battle, the salvo of the battlecruisers Seydlitz and Derfflinger destroyed the British battleship Queen Mary within seconds. In this naval battle, Seydlitz was hit 21 times by large caliber shells, one of which penetrated the workshop of the aft super firing turret. Although the resulting fire destroyed the turret, relevant safety measures prevented further disasters. This ship was also torpedoed during the battle, causing it to be flooded with over 5300 tons of water, reducing its freeboard to 2.5 meters, and destroying all five main gun turrets. In the absence of contact with the fleet, the Seydlitz single handedly stumbled back to its home base in Germany, which can be considered legendary. Its excellent damage management and protective design earned it the title of "unsinkable warship".
Like other surviving German battlecruisers in the war, the ship was detained in Scapa Flow in 1918. This ship sank in June 1919 along with the rest of the High Seas Fleet to prevent her from being captured by the British Royal Navy. She was salvaged on November 2, 1928 and dismantled in Rothes in 1930.
Ship of Friendship
Willing to announce friendship.
Unsinkable Legend
Military units do not suffer combat penalties when damaged and can retreat to designated districts to heal completely. When military units attack, they gain +1 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength for every 10 Hp they have; when defending, they gain +1 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength for every 10 Hp lost. [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great Generals and [ICON_GreatAdmiral] Great Admirals can provide +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement to military units within two tiles, and grant the "Iron-Willed Leader" unit command. Gain the SMS Seydlitz unique unit when the Steel technology is researched.
Military units do not suffer combat penalties when damaged and can retreat to designated districts to heal completely. When military units attack, they gain +1 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength for every 10 Hp they have; when defending, they gain +1 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength for every 10 Hp lost. [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great Generals and [ICON_GreatAdmiral] Great Admirals can provide +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement to military units within two tiles, and grant the "Iron-Willed Leader" unit command. Gain the SMS Seydlitz unique unit when the Refining technology is researched.
SMS Seydlitz
Seydlitz's unique Modern era naval unit that replaces the Battleship. Heals outside of friendly territory and at the end of every turn.

Iron-Willed Leader
Provides +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement for military units within two tiles.

Unsinkable Ship
Heals outside of friendly territory and at the end of every turn.
Unsinkable Legend
Can retreat to designated districts to heal completely.
Iron-Willed Leader
Can upgrade Land Combat units to [ICON_Corps] Corps or [ICON_Army] Army and grant [ICON_Gold] Gold equal to the unit's purchase cost, as well as [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General points equal to the unit's [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength.
Can upgrade Naval Combat units to [ICON_Corps] Fleets or [ICON_Army] Armadas and grant [ICON_Gold] Gold equal to the unit's purchase cost, as well as [ICON_GreatAdmiral] Great Admiral points equal to the unit's [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength.
